channel.title: Animations on Michael Lee
channel.description: Recent content in Animations on Michael Lee

item.title: Bar Chart - Parent Educational Attainment
item.description: Animation Linked here: What % of adults reported having a computer and the Internet always available for educational purposes in Spring 2020? Did results vary by parent educational attainment? Read our blog for the latest results from @uscensusbureau #HouseholdPulseSurvey: https://t.co/EyQIfLnWCI pic.twitter.com/VMWEkM6hFK — NCES (@EdNCES) August 7, 2020 Full image: Higher percentages of adults with higher levels of education than of adults with lower levels of education reported that computers and the Internet were always available for educational purposes for elementary and secondary students in their households.

item.title: Bar Chart Race - Changing Demographics in K–12 Public School Enrollment
item.description: Linked here: https://nces.ed.gov/blogs/nces/post/bar-chart-race-changing-demographics-in-postsecondary-enrollment Full image: Total enrollment in public elementary and secondary schools has grown since 1995, but it has not grown across all racial/ethnic groups. As such, racial/ethnic distributions of public school students across the country have shifted. Interested in learning more? Hire me to consult on your next project, follow me on twitter, leave a comment, or contact me via email. All inquiries welcome!

item.title: Bar Chart Race - Changing Demographics in Postsecondary Enrollment
item.description: Linked here: https://nces.ed.gov/blogs/nces/post/racing-bar-chart Full image: Fall enrollment of U.S. residents in degree-granting postsecondary institutions from 1976 to 2028 by race/ethnicity. item.title: State Map - Adjusted Cohort Graduation Rate (2020 update)
item.description: Animation linked here: DYK? The % of public school students in the U.S. who were English language learners (#ELL) was higher in fall 2017 (10.1%, or 5M) than in fall 2000 (8.1%, or 3.8M). Explore more #ELL data in our recently released #ConditionOfEd: https://t.co/bDLW50IqFu #EdChat pic.twitter.com/O0VrBEUi9a — NCES (@EdNCES) June 10, 2020 Full image: The % of public school students in the U.S. who were English language learners (#ELL) was higher in fall 2017 (10.

item.title: Line Chart - Master's Degrees Conferred
item.description: Animation Linked here: In 2010–11, business surpassed #education as the field in which the largest number of master’s degrees were conferred and has remained the largest field in each subsequent year. More #HigherEd data in the updated #ConditionOfEd: https://t.co/LLltZJq5I3 pic.twitter.com/1LIXjjUAA9 — NCES (@EdNCES) May 30, 2020 Full image: In 2010–11, business surpassed #education as the field in which the largest number of master’s degrees were conferred and has remained the largest field in each subsequent year.

item.title: Line Chart - College Enrollment Rate (2020 update)
item.description: Animation Linked here: NEW DATA: The immediate #CollegeEnrollment rate for Hispanic students was higher in 2018 (63%) than in 2000 (49%). Discover more #HigherEd updates from the #ConditionOfEd: https://t.co/r8gJkRDeK3 #HispanicEd pic.twitter.com/YVx3tvwOnK — NCES (@EdNCES) May 28, 2020 Full image: The immediate #CollegeEnrollment rate for Hispanic students was higher in 2018 (63%) than in 2000 (49%). item.title: Bar Chart - Median Annual Earnings (2020 update)
item.description: Animation Linked here: How did the median annual earnings of full-time, year-round workers ages 25–34 vary by sex and educational attainment? Dive into the #ConditionOfEd for more updated #EdStats: https://t.co/sM6BxRQHhG #EdChat pic.twitter.com/X4d2uFxyXl — NCES (@EdNCES) May 26, 2020 Full image: How did the median annual earnings of full-time, year-round workers ages 25–34 vary by sex and educational attainment? item.title: State Map - Adjusted Cohort Graduation Rate (2020 update)
item.description: Animation linked here: The adjusted cohort #GraduationRate (ACGR) is the % of public high school students who graduate w/ a regular diploma within 4 yrs of starting 9th grade for the first time. Browse our UPDATED table: https://t.co/gfP7FRpklr These data are also available at: https://t.co/XiWDUS38BA pic.twitter.com/JEybQL19qO — NCES (@EdNCES) March 13, 2020 Full image: The adjusted cohort #GraduationRate (ACGR) is the % of public high school students who graduate w/ a regular diploma within 4 yrs of starting 9th grade for the first time.

item.title: Line Chart - College Enrollment Rate
item.description: Animation Linked here: NEW STAT: The immediate college enrollment rate for #Hispanic students was higher in 2017 (67%) than in 2000 (49%). Discover more #EdStats in our 2019 #ConditionOfEd report: https://t.co/r8gJkRDeK3 #HispanicEd pic.twitter.com/amnDqvH8UH — NCES (@EdNCES) May 22, 2019 Full image: The immediate college enrollment rate for #Hispanic students was higher in 2017 (67%) than in 2000 (49%). item.title: Line Chart - Percentage of Students Reporting Being Bullied
item.description: Animation Linked here: NEW STAT: In 2017, 20% of students ages 12-18 reported being bullied at school during the school year, representing an overall decrease from 29% in 2005. More #EdSafetyStats in the Indicators of School Crime and Safety report, available now: https://t.co/Z4JLYLn5O8 @BJSgov pic.twitter.com/l7b3XH3kd2 — NCES (@EdNCES) April 19, 2019 Full image: Between 2005 and 2017, the percentage of students ages 12-18 who reported being bullied at school decreased from 29 to 20 percent

item.title: Line Chart - On Campus Crimes
item.description: In 2016, about 28,400 criminal incidents on #postsec institution campuses were reported to police/ security agencies, representing a 3% increase from 2015. Learn more #CampusCrime statistics in our NEW release: https://t.co/Wvco6IxkcC pic.twitter.com/HKxgHq8gAs — NCES (@EdNCES) April 17, 2019 Full image: Between 2001 and 2016, the total number of on-campus crimes reported at postsecondary institutions decreased by 32% Interested in learning more? Hire me to consult on your next project, follow me on twitter, leave a comment, or contact me via email.

item.title: Line Chart - Status Dropout Rate
item.description: Animation linked here: DYK? The #Hispanic status high school dropout rate ↓ from 27.8% to 8.6% between 2000 & 2016. What were the rates for Black & White students? Discover more: https://t.co/5SyF2HuBcJ #HispanicEd pic.twitter.com/Mg9MEzTeel — NCES (@EdNCES) February 22, 2019 Full image: Status dropout rates of 16 to 24 year olds, by race/ethnicity: 2000 through 2016 Interested in learning more? item.title: Average cumulative student loan balance for doctorate degree completers, by degree program: Selected years, 2000–2016
item.description: Animation seen here: Between 1999–2000 & 2015–16, avg. #StudentLoandebt for medical doctorate completers increased by 97% (from $124,700 to $246,000). More #statson student #debthere in our NEW blog: https://t.co/mz1F3aI943 pic.twitter.com/93mzhYkwgF — NCES (@EdNCES) August 18, 2018 Full image: Average cumulative student loan balance for doctorate degree completers, by degree program: Selected years, 2000–2016 Interested in learning more? item.title: Makeover Monday: WSJ Measles Vaccination Chart
item.description: Last week I wrote a post about recreating the WSJ measles vaccination chart as an animated cartogram - you can check out the full write-up of the development here: www.mikelee.co/posts/2017-06-28-wsj-measles-vaccination-chart/ It was featured on DataCamp across all their social media platforms - pretty neat! A comment from one of the readers (which disqus seems to have overwritten as I was re-initializing my site) read as so: Your measles chart is a beautiful piece of work!

item.title: Reproducing the WSJ Measles Vaccination Chart Using R Animation
item.description: Mastering Animation in R See the full write-up of the development here: www.mikelee.co/posts/2017-06-28-wsj-measles-vaccination-chart/ Wall Street Journal Measles Vaccination Chart Wall Street Journal Reproduced Animation Using R Measles Animation using animation Interested in learning more?
